condition.name: Confused
entries: A confused creature cannot take reactions.
On its turn, a confused creature rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does.

items: On a 1-4, a confused creature is debilitated until the end of its turn.
On a 5-6, a confused creature is dazed until the end of its turn.
On a 7+, a confused creature makes a melee weapon attack against a randomly determined creature at the start of its turn as a free action.

condition.name: Dazed
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition incapacitated}.
A dazed creature has disadvantage with Offence and Defence.

condition.name: Debilitated
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition stunned}.
A debilitated creature suffers the following effects:

items: Cannot take bonus actions or reactions.
Does not grant disadvantage to adjacent ranged attackers.

condition.name: Dominated
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition charmed}.

A dominated creature is {@condition charmed}. Additionally, dominated creature gains a free action at the start of each of its turns that can be taken to both move up to its speed and make either a single weapon attack or cast a cantrip. This free action is completely controlled by the creature that dominated the victim.

condition.name: Doomed
entries: A doomed creature dies at a time determined by the DM, or within 13 ({@dice 2d12}) hours.

A doomed creature continues to be doomed even after it dies. Magic equivalent to a 7th-level or higher spell can remove the doomed condition (such as {@spell regenerate|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E} cast on a living creature, {@spell resurrection|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E}, {@spell true resurrection|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E}, or {@spell wish|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E}. A doomed creature cannot otherwise be returned to life.

condition.name: Fatigue
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition exhaustion}.

rows: Disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution checks.
Speed halved and unable to maintain a fast travel pace.
Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws using Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution, and unable to maintain a normal travel pace.
Speed reduced to 5 feet and unable to maintain a slow travel pace.

condition.name: Rattled
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition frightened}.
A rattled creature cannot benefit from expertise dice and cannot take reactions.

condition.name: Slowed
entries: A slowed creature's speed is halved.
A slowed creature takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
A slowed creature cannot take reactions
On its turn, a slowed creature can take either an action or a bonus action, not both. In addition, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

condition.name: Sluggish
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition exhaustion}.
A sluggish creature reduces the number of attacks it can make with its Attack action by 1 (or Multiattack, where relevant).

condition.name: Staggered
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition paralyzed}.
A staggered creature suffers the following effects:

items: Incoming attack damage is always critical.
All speeds are set to 0 feet.

condition.name: Strife
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition exhaustion}.

rows: Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks.
Can only take a bonus or standard action each turn (not both).
Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws using Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
Suffer the effects of a random short-term mental stress effect.
Suffer the effects of a random long-term mental stress effect.

condition.name: Taunted
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition charmed}.
A taunted creature must target at least their taunter with all offensive actions.

condition.name: Weakened
entries: Shares condition immunity with {@condition stunned}.
A weakened creature deals half damage.

disease.name: Brain Larvae
entries: A {@creature khalkos|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E} can infect an intelligent creature with a horrifying disease, injecting {@creature khalkos|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E} larvae directly into the creature's skull. While infected with this disease, the host undergoes the following changes:

items.name: Telepathy
entries: The host gains telepathy out to a radius of 120 feet. Additionally, the host can telepathically communicate with the {@creature khalkos|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E} that infected it over any distance, as long as they are on the same plane.

items.name: Trust
entries: Whenever a {@creature khalkos|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E} makes a Charisma check to convince the host of its good intentions, it does so with advantage. If it succeeds, the host becomes friendly to it no matter its previous attitude.

After 10 ({@dice 3d6}) days, the host develops a splitting headache and is {@condition incapacitated} for 24 hours. At the end of this time, the host dies, and 2 or 3 {@creature khalkos spawn|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E} burst out of the host's skull after 1 round.

This disease can only be detected or cured by a spell cast with a 5th-level or higher spell slot. It can't be cured by effects that don't require a spell slot. Creatures without a head are immune to this disease.

disease.name: Mummy Rot
entries: A {@creature mummy|LevelUpAdventurersGuideA5E|mummy's} touch inflicts a dreadful curse called mummy rot. A cursed creature can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the creature's total number of Hit Dice for every 24 hours that elapse. If this curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies and crumbles to dust.
